examples: none of you want to work
don't use any more water, or there'll be none left for me

adverb.description: By no amount; not at all.
examples: it is made none the easier by the differences in approach

noun.description: A service forming part of the Divine Office of the Western Christian Church, traditionally said (or chanted) at the ninth hour of the day (3 p.m.).

phrases: her first customer was none other than Henry du Pont
And it was none other than Rossellini who advised him to turn professional.
The first victims of his surprise visit were none other than presspersons themselves.
With a wee bit of searching, I found out the mystery presenter is none other than Nance.
The show had to be good as it was choreographed by none other than irrepressible Padamsee.
origin: Mid 19th century: from French, from Latin nona, feminine singular of nonus ninth. Compare with noon.
